title: Ticket #3213: Could libexec/condor_ssh_to_job_shell_setup be sh?
description: The Condor tarballs distribute a script, libexec/condor_ssh_to_job_shell_setup, whose #! line is /bin/bash. This binary doesn't exist by default on FreeBSD 7.x, and so causes ssh-to-job to fail. It's not that it's a problem to fix (by switching to /usr/local/bin/bash), but that the file is in libexec/, so we don't normally think that we keep configuration information in there. The other two Condor SSH scripts just do #!/bin/sh, which works fine, so it'd be nice if condor_ssh_to_job_shell_setup could be changed to match. (I haven't looked at any of the scipts, but hopefully whoever wrote them still remembers them and can very quickly answer the question.)
